titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 1679: Heptameron des Ludowici Zypriani, de Mongold Arcanum Secretum, die Schaetze zu heben.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Magical handbook with instructions for conjuring angels for the seven days of the week. Sections include information on magical circles, prayers to recite for conjurations, and lists of divine names with their corresponding hours.

msItem.title: Heptameron des Ludowici Zypriani, de Mongold Arcanum Secretum, die Schaetze zu heben.

author.name: Charles Rainsford Collection of Alchemical and Occult Manuscripts (University of Pennsylvania)

supportDesc.extent: 50 leaves : 187 x 118 (167 x 110) mm bound to 188 x 120 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 50; [1-50]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a cursive script by a single hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Several diagrams and tables (f. 6v, 20r, 27r, 28v, ); alchemical symbols in red ink throughout.

origin.p: Written in Germany in the second half of the 18th century.

history.provenance: Sold at auction at Sotheby's (London), 15 July 2014, as part of Lot 411.
Formerly owned by Charles Rainsford (British army officer, fellow of the Royal Society, and alchemist); bequeathed by Rainsford to Hugh Percy, Second Duke of Northumberland.
Owned by the 2nd through 12th Dukes of Northumberland, ms. 590, Alnwick Castle, Northumberland, 1809-2014.
